sec.p:
Three primary contributors to vegetation cover, and thus surface stability, were selected for inclusion in the model: grazing pressure, wildfire occurrence, and climatic conditions. Instrumental measurements (capturing the last 100 years of climatic data) were not used due to the relatively short time series measured. A longer dendrochronological record of tree ring growth from the Niobrara Valley Preserve (NVP)
65 provided an integrated record of precipitation and temperature change over the past 400 years. Annual tree ring growth data was extracted and smoothed by a factor of 0.2 RLOESS function, to allow a signal to be identified by the model amongst the environmental noise. Grazing pressure for the six dune sites was based on the levels identified in the index defined in Buckland et al. (submitted – 16/08/2018) and smoothed by a moving average factor of 0.1 to represent progressive changes in management strategy. Wildfire occurrence was included as a binary input (i.e. ‘1’ – fire, ‘0’ – no fire) based on the fire scar records from NVP
76 .
